recipes: If I can afford to pay the fees, I may grow my strength - or learn something of myself besides. But I will likely come to harm.
I couldn't afford the club fees. Another time.
If I can afford to buy the necessary texts and journals, I can learn the disturbing philosophies of the new century. But many truths are hard to bear.
I couldn't afford the materials I needed. Another time.
Knowledge is a city wall built stone by stone. But what waits in the darkness beyond the walls? Why would we need a fortress, except that we had something to fear?
Truth is treasure seized from darkness. I've maintained my balance, and learnt something.

There are too many uncertainties; too many fears of the future; too many crushing terrors of possibility. I hardly dare learn these lessons. [You've gained Dread, which is a problem. However, Dread can be transformed to Reason, with time and rest.]
Experience is the best teacher. I've glimpsed something greater. I'll seek it in sensation: the pleasures of sight, flesh and spirit. But all delights have their dangers.
I couldn't pay for the pleasures I sought. Another time.
